title: [Bug] SKPath AddArc does not show smooth arc when IsAntialias is true
body:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Using SKPath to draw an arc shows arcs a bit pixeled.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a SKPoint in the center of the screen.
```csharp
        SKPoint center = new SKPoint(Info.Width / 2, Info.Height / 2);
            float radius = (float)Size / 2;
```
2. Create a SKRect 
```csharp
     SKRect dimensions = new SKRect(center.X - radius, center.Y - radius,
                center.X + radius, center.Y + radius);
```
3. Create a SKPaint
```csharp
          var paint = new SKPaint()
            {
                Style = SKPaintStyle.Stroke,
                Color = color, //pick any color
                StrokeWidth = strokeWidth,
                IsAntialias = true,
            };
```
4. Draw the arc
```csharp
    SKPath skPath = new SKPath();
            skPath.AddArc(skRectangle, dimensions.StartAngle, dimensions.SweepAngle);
            canvas.DrawPath(skPath, paint);
```

### Expected Behavior

A smooth arc.

### Actual Behavior

Here is a picture of my circle made using arcs (code attached). If you run the code you would see that the graphic looks chunky in some places



![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16247065/90888315-a52e9f00-e37b-11ea-9545-868eb2ccffd8.png)
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: Latest version of Skia and Xamarin Forms
- IDE: VS 2019
